item.description: When the CPU assigns memory to processes that require it, it typically does so in 4 KB page chunks. Because the CPU’s MMU unit actively needs to translate virtual memory to physical memory upon incoming I/O requests, going through all 4 KB pages is naturally an expensive operation.
